answers.answer: Hi,Sorry English is my 3rd language, so I could be wrong anatomically about the exact site you are pointing at by saying " on top of my first butt muscle" you could be describing the area of Sacral 1-2 roots? which is either compressed by a disc or affected internally by a vascular complication like in diabetes..ext  anyway its cleare from worsoning on sneezing or coughing ,its a root irritation..to explain it better:Coughing or sneezing causes  transient increase in the pressure across the dura (one of the natural layers covering the spinal cord) which will lead to worsening symptoms associated with nerve root disease.Try to see you GP (family physcian) so he/she could examine you and order the MRI/other testsHope this is helpfulBob Hilton

question: On the left side of my hip, on the surface of the skin directly on top of my first butt muscle, it is numb.  I can feel pressure if I rub it, but no sensation.  If I bend down, or am sitting and either cough or sneeze, a VERY SHARP pain is felt directly on the surface of the skin where it was numb "instantaneously".   It feels like there are about a thousand needles poking me all at the same time, and it goes away as quickly as it comes.  It feels absolutely normal at all other times.  No sore muscles or anything.  What is this.
title: Numb skin on left side of hip
